lines.text: fifty years ago, this was the very place I lost my cherry.
I'm afraid of what'll happen if I stay.

[following Harry around tombstones until he's discovered]
Harry, if I wanted you dead, do you think I'd be walking around here.

[indignantly to Harry]
You honestly think we'd send up one of our people up to a railroad station in Connecticut just to push you under a train? Okay? OKAY? Now I don't know what you think is goin' on, but it's not us. I just hope it's not you!

[Ellie looking unusually glamorous at a wine social]
You look, huh, wonderful!
Well, sherry requires a certain effort, doesn't it?

[referring to the death note he's received]
Wait a minute! Wait a minute! You mean there 's more than one of these?
Then I'm not the only one?
No, but don't despair. You have a distinction.

[laughs nervously]
You seem to be the only one still alive.
